trans-unit.source: Retrieves information about the raw input device

target.mrk: Retrieves information about the raw input device

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: A handle to the raw input device. This comes from the "lParam" of the WM_INPUT message, from the

seg-source.mrk: A handle to the raw input device.
This comes from the "lParam" of the WM_INPUT message, from the

target.mrk: A handle to the raw input device.
This comes from the "lParam" of the WM_INPUT message, from the

trans-unit.source: "$hDevice" member of the $tagRAWINPUTHEADER structure, or from the _WinAPI_EnumRawInputDevices() function.

seg-source.mrk: "$hDevice" member of the $tagRAWINPUTHEADER structure, or from the _WinAPI_EnumRawInputDevices() function.

target.mrk: "$hDevice" member of the $tagRAWINPUTHEADER structure, or from the _WinAPI_EnumRawInputDevices() function.

trans-unit.source: A pointer to the buffer that receives an information specified by a command flag (see below).

seg-source.mrk: A pointer to the buffer that receives an information specified by a command flag (see below).

target.mrk: A pointer to the buffer that receives an information specified by a command flag (see below).

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0, the function returns the required size of the buffer, in bytes or characters.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0, the function returns the required size of the buffer, in bytes or characters.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0, the function returns the required size of the buffer, in bytes or characters.

trans-unit.source: The size of the buffer, in bytes. For $RIDI_DEVICENAME only, this value is the character count,

seg-source.mrk: The size of the buffer, in bytes.
For $RIDI_DEVICENAME only, this value is the character count,

target.mrk: The size of the buffer, in bytes.
For $RIDI_DEVICENAME only, this value is the character count,

trans-unit.source: including null-terminating character (not the byte count).

seg-source.mrk: including null-terminating character (not the byte count).

target.mrk: including null-terminating character (not the byte count).

trans-unit.source: The command flag that specifies what information will be returned.

seg-source.mrk: The command flag that specifies what information will be returned.

target.mrk: The command flag that specifies what information will be returned.

trans-unit.source: This parameter can be one of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values.

target.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: $RIDI_DEVICENAME

seg-source.mrk: $RIDI_DEVICENAME

target.mrk: $RIDI_DEVICENAME

trans-unit.source: $RIDI_DEVICEINFO

seg-source.mrk: $RIDI_DEVICEINFO

target.mrk: $RIDI_DEVICEINFO

trans-unit.source: $RIDI_PREPARSEDDATA

seg-source.mrk: $RIDI_PREPARSEDDATA

target.mrk: $RIDI_PREPARSEDDATA

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: The number of bytes or characters required or copied into the buffer.

seg-source.mrk: The number of bytes or characters required or copied into the buffer.

target.mrk: The number of bytes or characters required or copied into the buffer.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.
